definition[0]: to be in charge of a group of workers and check that a piece of work is done satisfactorily
example[0]: A team leader was appointed to oversee the project.
definition[1]: to organize and control an activity or the work that people or an organization do
definition[2]: to be responsible for making investments
example[1]: He oversaw $80 billion in assets in his previous post.
definition[3]: to check that an activity is being performed honestly and legally
example[2]: The government set up a state watchdog to oversee the countryâ€™s alcohol production.
